item.title: [LeetCode] 136. Single Number
item.author: Debakar Roy
item.description: Single Number Link to original Problem on LeetCode Given a non-empty array of integers, every element appears twice except for one. Find that single one. Note: Your algorithm should have a linear runtime complexity. Could you implement it without using extra memory? Example 1: Input: [2,2,1] Output: 1 Example 2: Input: [4,1,2,1,2] Output: 4 Company: Amazon Solution (Using HashMap): Time Complexity: O(n) Space Complexity: O(n) class Solution(object): def singleNumber(self, nums): """ :type nums: List[int] :rtype: int """ # Keep a dictionary count and at the end just check whether any number has a count of 1 numCount = {} for num in nums: numCount[num] = numCount.
